title: Exit
body:
You went out of the range of the NPC character!
Come closer to reinitiate dialogue.

title: Enter
body:
Hello! This is the test Yarn file for the NPC character.
Press "Actions" to test linked command actions, or "Dialogue" to run a simple dialogue.
[[Actions]][[Dialogue]][[Exit]]

title: End
body:
This is the end. <<image none>><<video none>>
Click "Restart" to back to main menu.
[[Restart|Enter]]

title: Dialogue
body:
ChatGPT generated to query:
"make a simple dialogue tree about a topic of your choice."
Sure, here's a simple dialogue tree about learning a new programming language:
[[Play Dialogue|Intro]]

title: Conclusion
body:
This is just a basic example of a dialogue tree about learning a new programming language. 
Depending on the language and the audience, the tree could be much more complex and tailored to the learner's needs.
[[Restart|Enter]]

title: Question_1
body:
Do you have any programming experience?
[[Yes|Question_1a]][[No|Concepts]]

title: Question_1a
body:
What languages have you programmed in before?
[[Python]][[Java]][[JavaScript]]

title: Concepts
body:
Okay!
Here are some basic programming concepts:
[[Variables]][[Control structures]][[Functions]][[Data Types]][[Operators]][[Input/Output]][[Debugging]]

title: Python
body:
show how the new language is similar to Python and the key differences to be aware of.
[[Next Question|Question 2]]

body:
show how the new language is similar to Java and the key differences to be aware of.
[[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: JavaScript
body:
show how the new language is similar to JavaScript and the key differences to be aware of.
[[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Question 2
body:
What is your goal for learning how to use ARENA?
[[To get a job]][[To build a personal project]][[to learn something new]]

title: To get a job
body:
show job market trends for the language and relevant job openings.
[[Next Question|Question_3]]

body:
show examples of projects that can be built with the language.
[[Next Question|Question_3]]

body:
show some interesting features of the language and how it can be used.
[[Next Question|Question_3]]

title: Question_3
body:

[[Books]][[Video]][[Online Courses]]

body:

[[basic understanding]][[intermediate understanding]][[advanced understanding]]

show some advanced resources on the language.
[[Next Question|Question_5]]

title: basic understanding

[[Next Question|Question_5]]

title: Question_5
body:
Do you prefer a structured or unstructured learning approach?
[[Structured]][[Unstructured]]

title: Structured
body:
show some courses or books that offer a structured learning approach.
[[Conclusion]]

title: Unstructured
body:
show some resources that offer a more flexible learning approach, such as tutorials or video series.
[[Conclusion]]

title: Intro
body:
I'm going to talk about how to use ARENA!
First I am going to ask some questions to you.
[[Question_1]]

title: URLs
body:
Here is a list of all the URLs in this dialogue:
[[Wikipedia Fish PopUp]][[Youtube Frog PopUp]][[Arena Popup]][[Conix NewTab]][[NewScene Island SameTab]]

title: Print
body:
Using print command: <<print ("hello you are a fish")>>
[[Miscellaneous]][[Actions]][[End]]

title: Variables
body:
A variable is a container that stores a value or data. 
It can be thought of as a named storage location,
that can hold different types of data, 
such as numbers, strings, or boolean values.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Control structures
body:
Control structures are used to control the flow of program execution. 
Examples of control structures include if-else statements, loops, and switch statements.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Functions
body:
Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task. 
They allow you to write code once and use it multiple times.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Data Types
body:
Programming languages have different data types that can be used to store and manipulate data. 
Common data types include integers, floating-point numbers, strings, and booleans.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Operators
body:
Operators are symbols or keywords used to perform operations on data. 
Examples of operators include arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /), 
comparison operators (>, <, ==), 
and logical operators (&&, ||).
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Input/Output
body:
Input and output are important concepts in programming. 
Input refers to data that is received by a program, 
while output refers to data that is produced by a program.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Debugging
body:
Debugging is the process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in a program. 
It is an important skill for any programmer.
[[Concepts]][[Next Question|Question 2]]

title: Books

show some popular books on the language and their reviews.
